parameters.Gp:
a factor with 12 levels, giving abbreviations for the groups: 
D0 D1 D3 D6 S0 S1 S3 S6 T0 T1 T3 T6
parameters.Contour: a factor with 3 levels: Depression Slope Top
parameters.Group: a factor with 12 levels, corresponding to the combinations of Contour and Depth

title: Soil Compositions of Physical and Chemical Characteristics
description:
Description
Soil characteristics were measured on samples from three types of
contours (Top, Slope, and Depression) and at four depths (0-10cm,
10-30cm, 30-60cm, and 60-90cm).  The area was divided into 4 
blocks, in a randomized block design. (Suggested by Michael Friendly.)
reference:
These data provide good examples of MANOVA and canonical discriminant analysis in a somewhat
complex multivariate setting.  They may be treated as a one-way design (ignoring Block),
by using either Group or Gp as the factor, or a two-way randomized block
design using Block, Contour and Depth (quantitative, so orthogonal
polynomial contrasts are useful).
format: A data frame with 48 observations on the following 14 variables.  There are 3 factors and 9 response variables.
